actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1480 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure amendment in the nature of a substitute as an original bill for purpose of amendment, modified by the amendments printed in part 1 of H. Rept. 106-120. All points of order against consideration of the amendment in the nature of a substitute are waived. No amendment to that amendment are in order except those printed in part 2 of H. Rept. 106-120. Each of these amendments may be offered only by a Member designated in the report. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-120, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 50.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 154.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1480) to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the United States Army Corps of Engineers to construct various projects for improvements to rivers and harbors of the United States, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 1480 (water resources development).

titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1480) to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the United States Army Corps of Engineers to construct various projects for improvements to rivers and harbors of the United States, and for other purposes.
